intro: Silene odontopetala var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its pink to purple flowers and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, arid conditions. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in xeriscapes.
